question: Will the body of water currently called the "Gulf of Mexico" on the National Map be renamed the "Gulf of America" before March 1, 2025?
description:
According to Donald Trump's executive order [Restoring Names That Honor American Greatness](https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/FR-2025-01-31/pdf/2025-02096.pdf) signed January 20, 2025: 

> The area formerly known as the Gulf of Mexico has long been an integral asset to our once burgeoning Nation and has remained an indelible part of America. \[...] The Gulf will continue to play a pivotal role in shaping America’s future and the global economy, and in recognition of this flourishing economic resource and its critical importance to our Nation’s economy and its people, I am directing that it officially be renamed the Gulf of America.

Additionally: 

> As such, within 30 days of the date of this order, the Secretary of the Interior shall, consistent with 43 U.S.C. 364 through 364f, take all appropriate actions to rename as the ‘‘Gulf of America’’ the U.S. Continental Shelf area bounded on the northeast, north, and northwest by the States of Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama and Florida and extending to the seaward boundary with Mexico and Cuba in the area formerly named as the Gulf of Mexico. The Secretary shall subsequently update the GNIS to reflect the renaming of the Gulf and remove all references to the Gulf of Mexico from the GNIS, consistent with applicable law. The Board shall provide guidance to ensure all federal references to the Gulf of America, including on agency maps, contracts, and other documents and communica- tions shall reflect its renaming.

The National Map at nationalmap.gov is "a collaborative effort among the USGS and other Federal, State, and local partners to improve and deliver topographic information for the Nation. It has many uses ranging from recreation to scientific analysis to emergency response."

As of February 1, 2025, it had the body of water west of Florida, south of Louisiana, and north of Mexico's Yucatán Peninsula still labelled as the Gulf of Mexico on the National Map:

![](https://metaculus-web-media.s3.amazonaws.com/user_uploaded/Screenshot_2025-02-01_at_12.01.20%C3%A2PM.png)
fine_print: If there is no name at all on the body of water, this resolves as **No**. For this to count, it must be called the Gulf of America on the National Map. If multiple names are used (e.g., "Gulf of America formerly known as Gulf of Mexico"), it will count as long as Gulf of America is one of the names.
news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**'Gulf of America' Name May Not Last Past Trump's Presidency: Expert**
US President Donald Trump's executive order renaming the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America may not last past his presidency, according to David Rain, a professor of geography and international affairs at George Washington University. The Associated Press has decided to refer to the mountain Denali as Mount McKinley, but will continue to use the original name 'Gulf of Mexico' while acknowledging the new name. Mexico's president, Claudia Sheinbaum, has jokingly suggested renaming North America to 'América Mexicana' or 'Mexican America' in response to Trump's decision. Google Maps has agreed to change the name in its software, but Mexico has sent a letter of complaint to Google, stating that countries should not change the names of international bodies of water, but rather international organizations should do so. 'The Gulf of Mexico has carried that name for more than 400 years,' said the AP statement. 'The Associated Press will refer to it by its original name while acknowledging the new name Trump has chosen.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: February 08, 2025 02:47 PM
Source:[CNET](https://www.cnet.com/tech/services-and-software/gulf-of-america-name-may-not-last-past-trumps-presidency-expert/)

**US President Trump Renames Gulf of Mexico to 'Gulf of America'**
US President Donald Trump has issued an executive order to rename the Gulf of Mexico to 'Gulf of America'. The move aims to reverse a centuries-old tradition and has already sparked international reactions. Trump wants to rename the Gulf because he believes it is a vital part of the US economy, connecting five southern US states to Mexico and the Caribbean, and accounting for 14% of US oil production. However, the main driver behind Trump's decision seems to be a nationalist sentiment. The executive order is titled 'Restoring Names that Reflect America's Greatness with Pride'. Trump has also ordered the renaming of Mount McKinley, the highest peak in the US, to its original name, Mount Denali, which was changed in 2015 during the presidency of Barack Obama. The US Geological Survey has announced that it will start using the new name, but it is unclear if other countries will follow suit. Google has also announced that it will start using the new name in its maps for US users, but will continue to use the original name for users in Mexico. The US Interior Department has been tasked with implementing the change, including updating the Geographic Names Information System, a database that includes official names of geographic features in the US. The US Board on Geographic Names has been instructed to provide guidance to ensure that all federal agencies start using the new name in their maps, contracts, and official documents. The Mexican government has no official way to object to the change, as the US has the right to name its own geographic features. However, the Mexican president has criticized Google's decision and called on the company to reconsider. She has also joked that if the Gulf is renamed, the world should consider using the original name for the southwestern US.
Original language: ar
Publish date: February 08, 2025 02:38 PM
Source:[صحيفة الاقتصادية](https://www.aleqt.com/2025/02/08/article_2756781.html)

**Illinois Gov. Ridicules Trump's 'Gulf Of America' Proposal With 1 Of His Own**
Illinois Governor JB Pritzker mocked Donald Trump's proposal to rename the Gulf of Mexico as the 'Gulf of America' by announcing a satirical plan to change the name of Lake Michigan to Lake Illinois. Pritzker said, 'The world's finest geographers, experts who study the Earth's natural environment, have concluded a decades-long council and determined that a great lake deserves to be named after a great state.' He also jokingly announced that his state would be annexing Green Bay, Wisconsin, 'to protect itself against enemies, foreign and domestic.' Pritzker's move seems to be a response to Trump's previous declarations, including his plan to buy and control Greenland.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 08, 2025 11:16 AM
Source:[Democratic Underground](https://www.democraticunderground.com/10143391801)

**Illinois governor trolls President Trump in video announcing Lake Michigan's new name**
Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker released a parody video announcing the renaming of Lake Michigan to 'Lake Illinois', in a clear jab at President Donald Trump's recent executive order to rename the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America. Pritzker stated that the proclamation was forwarded to Google, which will update the world's maps to reflect the change. He also mentioned plans to annex Green Bay, a move that could gain Illinois the third-oldest NFL franchise, the Packers. Pritzker's video also referenced Trump's alleged interest in acquiring Greenland and the Panama Canal. The U.S. Board on Geographic Names has the power to rename geographic places within the United States, but changes are discouraged unless there is a compelling reason. Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has already embraced the change, using the term 'Gulf of America' in a state of emergency declaration. Pritzker said, 'The world's finest geographers, experts who study the Earth's natural environment have concluded a decades-long council and determined that a Great Lake deserves to be named after a great state,' and 'I've also instructed my team to work diligently to prepare for an important announcement next week regarding the Mississippi River,' and 'God Bless America, and Bear Down.'
Original language: en
Publish date: February 07, 2025 11:26 PM
Source:[Yahoo](https://ca.news.yahoo.com/illinois-governor-trolls-president-trump-232337634.html)

**VIDEO: Gov. JB Pritzker, Poking Fun At Trump, Says Lake Michigan Is Now Called ‘Lake Illinois’**
Illinois Governor JB Pritzker jokingly announced that Lake Michigan has been renamed to Lake Illinois, in a response to President Donald Trump's renaming of the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America. Pritzker said, 'The world's finest geographers, experts who study the Earth's natural environment, have concluded a decades-long council and determined that a Great Lake deserves to be named after a great state.' He then issued a proclamation declaring the change, which he claimed had been forwarded to Google to update the world's maps. The move is seen as a lighthearted jab at Trump's previous attempts to rename geographical features.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 07, 2025 09:47 PM
Source:[upolitics.com](https://upolitics.com/news/video-gov-jb-pritzker-poking-fun-at-trump-says-lake-michigan-is-now-called-lake-illinois/)

**The Dangerous Thinking Behind Trump's Attempt to Rename the Gulf of Mexico**
US President Donald Trump's executive order to rename the Gulf of Mexico 'Gulf of America' is not just a symbolic gesture, but a move to expand the US empire by erasing Mexico's presence from a geographical feature recognized for centuries. This is part of a long pattern of anti-Mexican racism in the US, ranging from political scapegoating and border militarization to violent rhetoric that fuels hate crimes. The move also fits into a larger US strategy of controlling the Western Hemisphere, which dates back to the Monroe Doctrine of 1823. Renaming the Gulf of Mexico could have devastating consequences, including the assertion of US territorial and economic claims over the region's rich natural resources. Companies like Google Maps, which has announced plans to rename the Gulf of Mexico, are playing into the billionaire-fueled power grab that advances a racist, nationalist agenda of domination and imperialism.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 06, 2025 12:00 AM
Source:[commondreams.org](https://www.commondreams.org/opinion/trump-gulf-of-mexico)

**EPA Renames Its Gulf Division to Honor the Gulf of America**
The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has renamed its Gulf of Mexico Division to the Gulf of America Division (GAD) in accordance with President Trump's Executive Order. Administrator Lee Zeldin said, 'The Gulf of America is a flourishing economic resource critical to our nation's economy.' The Gulf of America is home to vibrant American fisheries and is recognized as one of the most productive fisheries in the world, contributing millions of dollars to local American economies. The EPA is committed to protecting the 1,630 miles of this watershed and improving water and habitat quality through its Gulf of America Division.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 05, 2025 12:00 PM
Source:[epa.gov](https://www.epa.gov/newsreleases/epa-renames-its-gulf-division-honor-gulf-america)

**Renaming The Gulf of Mexico Isn’t A Laughing Matter But Part of a U.S. Imperialist Power Grab**
The Trump administration's executive order to rename the Gulf of Mexico the 'Gulf of America' is a move to erase historical identity and assert imperial domination over a region already suffering under a long history of interventionist policies. This is part of a larger U.S. strategy of controlling the Western Hemisphere, dating back to the Monroe Doctrine of 1823. The renaming is also a territorial and economic claim over the waters and their resources, further cementing U.S. imperial ambitions in the region. Companies like Google Maps, which has announced plans to rename the Gulf of Mexico, are playing into the billionaire-fueled power grab that advances a racist, nationalist agenda of domination and imperialism. The Gulf of Mexico is a shared resource of immense ecological, economic, and cultural significance for Mexico, the United States, and the world, and its renaming could have devastating consequences, including a disregard for historical truth, aggressive assertion of U.S. superiority, and continuation of exploitative colonialist practices that harm both the environment and Latin American people.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 05, 2025 12:35 AM
Source:[pressenza.com](https://www.pressenza.com/2025/02/renaming-the-gulf-of-mexico-isnt-a-laughing-matter-but-part-of-a-u-s-imperialist-power-grab/)

**Mexican President Protests Google Maps Change to 'Gulf of America'**
Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum has sent a letter to Google protesting the change of 'Gulf of Mexico' to 'Gulf of America' on Google Maps. The change was announced by Google on January 28, 2025, following a presidential order by Donald Trump to rename the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America. According to Sheinbaum, the name change is not legally possible as the Gulf of Mexico is defined by the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea as a body of water within the territorial waters of Mexico. Sheinbaum also proposed renaming the United States to 'Mexican America' and suggested that Google display maps with this name when users search for 'Mexican America'.
Original language: ja
Publish date: January 31, 2025 03:39 AM
Source:[GIGAZINE](https://gigazine.net/news/20250131-gulf-of-mexico-america/)

**Google Maps and Apple Maps to Change 'Gulf of Mexico' to 'Gulf of America'**
Google Maps will change the name of the Gulf of Mexico to 'Gulf of America' in the future, following the official renaming by the US government. Apple Maps has already started displaying the new name, but only when specifically searched for. The change will be applied globally, but with some exceptions. In Google Maps, US users will only see the new name, while users outside the US will see both the old and new names. Mexican users will still see the old name. Apple Maps currently displays the old name, but shows the new name when searched for. It is assumed that Apple will follow Google's approach and update the name once the change is made in the US government's database. The renaming was made official by a decree signed by former US President Trump on January 20, 2025, which also renamed the Mount McKinley in Alaska to Denali. According to the US government, the renaming aims to 'restore names that praise America's greatness'.
Original language: de
Publish date: January 30, 2025 03:26 PM
Source:[curved.de](https://curved.de/news/golf-von-amerika-google-maps-und-apple-maps-ziehen-mit-770002)

**Sheinbaum to Send Letter to Google Over Renaming of Gulf of Mexico**
Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum announced on Wednesday that she will send a letter to Google after the company renamed the Gulf of Mexico as 'Gulf of America' in its maps in the United States, following an order from former US President Donald Trump. Sheinbaum argued that the decree has to do with Trump's continental platform, so the tech company should distinguish between US territory and international waters. Sheinbaum joked that she will also ask Google to call the US 'America Mexicana'. 'We are sending a letter to Google first to say: I suppose Google Maps knows about this international division, it also knows which organization is responsible for naming international seas and what would correspond to the continental platform,' Sheinbaum explained. The president questioned Google's decision, which explained on social media X that it renamed the Gulf in its US maps, citing that it is the current official name of that area in the US. Sheinbaum pointed out that Trump's order applies to the US continental platform in the Gulf, but not to the international body of water. 'The day after tomorrow, we will show you the letter we are sending today because it is very important to put everything in its proper context in publications. To change the name of an international sea, it is not a country that changes it, it is an international organization,' Sheinbaum stated. Sheinbaum insisted that for the rest of the world, it will continue to be called the Gulf of Mexico, citing a publication by The Telegraph that the UK will not recognize the new name assigned by Trump. 'It cannot be anything more than a country's definition, since a country has jurisdiction over its territory, not over the part that is international sea,' Sheinbaum noted. Sheinbaum recalled that in 17th-century maps, where the Gulf of Mexico was already mentioned, it was also called 'America Mexicana' to the current US and Canadian territory, so she joked that she will ask Google to make this change. 'We will also ask that America Mexicana appear, that when one puts America Mexicana, the map appears,' Sheinbaum said.
Original language: es
Publish date: January 29, 2025 09:31 PM
Source:[elperiodicousa.com](https://www.elperiodicousa.com/sheinbaum-enviara-carta-a-google-tras-renombrar-el-golfo-de-mexico-como-golfo-de-america/)

**Mexico to Send Letter to Google Over Renaming of Gulf of Mexico**
Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum announced on Wednesday that she will send a letter to Google after the company renamed the Gulf of Mexico to 'Gulf of America' in its maps in the United States. Sheinbaum argued that Google should distinguish between US territory and international waters. 'We are sending a letter to Google to say: I suppose Google Maps knows about this international division, knows which organization is responsible for naming international seas and what would correspond to the continental shelf,' Sheinbaum explained. Sheinbaum questioned Google's decision, which explained on social media X that it renamed the Gulf in its US maps because it is the current official name of that area in the US. Sheinbaum seeks to clarify with Google the controversy over the Gulf of Mexico, which Trump ordered to be renamed in his first day in office, January 20, applies to the US continental shelf of the Gulf, but not to the international body of water. 'The letter we are sending, because it is very important to put everything in its proper context in publications. To change the name of an international sea, it is not a country that changes it, it is an international organization,' Sheinbaum stated. Sheinbaum insisted that for the rest of the world, the Gulf of Mexico will continue to be called the Gulf of Mexico, citing a publication by the British newspaper The Telegraph that the UK will not recognize the new name assigned by Trump. 'It cannot be just a definition of a country, since a country has jurisdiction over its territory, not over the part that is international sea,' Sheinbaum noted. Sheinbaum joked that she will also ask Google to change the name of 'America Mexicana' to 'United States of America' in its maps, as it was called in 17th-century maps when the Gulf of Mexico was also referred to as 'America Mexicana'.
Original language: es
Publish date: January 29, 2025 07:03 PM
Source:[conclusion.com.ar](https://www.conclusion.com.ar/internacionales/mexico-enviara-una-carta-a-google-que-usa-en-sus-mapas-el-nombre-de-golfo-de-america/01/2025/)

**Sheinbaum sends letter to Google over renaming of Gulf of Mexico**
Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum announced on Wednesday that she will send a letter to Google after the company renamed the Gulf of Mexico to 'Gulf of America' in its US maps in response to a decree by former US President Donald Trump. Sheinbaum argued that the decree is related to the US continental platform, and Google should distinguish between US territory and international waters. Sheinbaum joked that she will also ask Google to call the US 'American Mexico'. 'We are sending a letter to Google to say: I suppose Google Maps knows about this international division, also knows which organization is responsible for naming international seas and what would correspond to the continental platform,' Sheinbaum explained. Sheinbaum questioned Google's decision, which explained on social media X that it renamed the Gulf in its US maps because it is the current official name in the US. Sheinbaum argued that the decree applies only to the US continental platform of the Gulf, not to the international body of water. 'Tomorrow we will show you the letter we will send today because it is very important to put everything in its proper context in publications. To change the name of an international sea, it is not a country that changes it, it is an international organization,' Sheinbaum stated. Sheinbaum insisted that for the rest of the world, it will continue to be called the Gulf of Mexico, citing a publication by the British newspaper The Telegraph that the UK will not recognize the new name assigned by Trump. 'It cannot be anything more than a country's definition, since a country has jurisdiction over its territory, not over the part that is international sea,' Sheinbaum noted. Sheinbaum recalled that in 17th-century maps, which already spoke of the Gulf of Mexico, it was also called 'American Mexico' to the current territory of the US and Canada, and joked that she will ask Google to make this change.
Original language: es
Publish date: January 29, 2025 05:55 PM
Source:[LA GRAN ÉPOCA](https://es.theepochtimes.com/news/sheinbaum-envia-carta-google-renombrar-golfo-de-mexico-1331221.html)

**Mexico's President Sheinbaum to Send Letter to Google Over 'Gulf of America' Renaming**
Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum announced that she will send a letter to Google after the company renamed the Gulf of Mexico to 'Gulf of America' in its US maps, following an order from former US President Donald Trump. Sheinbaum argued that the decree has to do with Trump's continental platform, so the tech company should distinguish between US territory and international waters. She joked that she will also ask Google to call the US 'America Mexicana'. 'We are sending a letter to Google first to say: I suppose Google Maps knows about this international division, it also knows which organization is responsible for naming international seas and what would correspond to the continental platform,' Sheinbaum explained. The president questioned Google's decision, which explained on social media that it renamed the Gulf in its US maps because it is the current official name in that country. Sheinbaum argued that the order only applies to the US continental platform, not the international body of water. 'Tomorrow we will show you the letter we are sending today because it is very important to put everything in its proper context in publications. To change the name of an international sea, it is not a country that changes it, it is an international organization,' she said. Sheinbaum insisted that the rest of the world will continue to call it the Gulf of Mexico, citing a publication from The Telegraph that the UK will not recognize the new name assigned by Trump. 'It cannot be just a country's definition, since a country has jurisdiction over its territory, not over the part that is international sea,' she noted. Sheinbaum also joked that she will ask Google to show 'America Mexicana' when someone searches for it, referencing maps from the 17th century that called the Gulf of Mexico 'America Mexicana' and the US and Canada 'America Mexicana' as well.
Original language: es
Publish date: January 29, 2025 04:52 PM
Source:[elmostrador.cl](https://www.elmostrador.cl/noticias/mundo/2025/01/29/presidenta-sheinbaum-enviara-carta-a-google-tras-renombrar-golfo-de-mexico-como-golfo-de-america/)

**Google to Change Name of Gulf of Mexico to 'Gulf of America' on US Maps**
Google has announced that it will change the name of the Gulf of Mexico to 'Gulf of America' on its maps used within the United States, following a decision by the Trump administration. This change is in line with an executive order signed by Trump on his first day in office, which aims to 'restore names that honor the greatness of America'. However, the Gulf will retain its original name in Mexico and other countries. According to Claudia Sheinbaum, president of Mexico, 'these changes do not alter the conventions or international agreements that designate this body of water as the Gulf of Mexico.' The move has sparked a diplomatic row between the two countries, with Mexico and the international community continuing to recognize the Gulf as the Gulf of Mexico.
Original language: es
Publish date: January 29, 2025 04:30 AM
Source:[elcordillerano.com.ar](https://www.elcordillerano.com.ar/noticias/2025/01/29/206412-google-le-cambiara-el-nombre-al-golfo-de-mexico-en-sus-mapas-de-estados-unidos)

**Maps are already being changed to 'Gulf of America.' It's not a simple process.**
President Donald Trump's executive order to rename the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America has already resulted in changes across the federal government and military, with Google Maps indicating it would also reflect the change. However, the process is complex and involves updating official documents, communications, maps, and charts. While some Republicans have welcomed the move, it has been met with backlash and confusion from internationally, with Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum saying 'for us and for the whole world, it is still the Gulf of Mexico.' The change is only effective domestically, and other nations and international organizations could continue to refer to the region as the Gulf of Mexico. According to Trump's executive order, the Secretary of the Interior has 30 days to implement the name change. As of now, Apple Maps hasn't renamed the body of water, and The Associated Press will still use the name Gulf of Mexico while acknowledging the Gulf of America in its style guide.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 28, 2025 09:01 PM
Source:[Business Insider](https://www.businessinsider.com/changing-us-maps-to-gulf-of-america-isnt-simple-process-2025-1)

**Google Maps will rename the Gulf of Mexico as the Gulf of America, following Trump**
Google announced plans to rename the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America in its Maps application, following a recent executive order issued by President Donald Trump. The change will be implemented once updates are made in federal geographic databases and will only affect users in the United States. Google cited its longstanding policy of updating map information when official sources introduce new data, noting adjustments to the names of Mount McKinley and Denali as similar examples. The renaming will not affect global recognition of the body of water, which will still be recognized as the Gulf of Mexico outside the US and in Mexico. This change is part of Google's broader plan to update its maps based on new government directives and official geographic databases, ensuring users access the most current and accurate information.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 28, 2025 03:36 PM
Source:[Quartz](https://qz.com/google-maps-gulf-of-mexico-america-trump-rename-1851749125)

**Google Maps will rename Gulf of Mexico as 'Gulf of America' in US**
Google has announced that it will rename the Gulf of Mexico as the Gulf of America on Google Maps in the US, following an executive order by US President Donald Trump. However, users in Mexico will still see the Gulf of Mexico. Google stated, 'We have a longstanding practice of applying name changes when they have been updated in official government.' The changes will occur once the US government updates its official listings for the body of water. Trump previously mentioned the plan, saying the Gulf of America had 'a beautiful ring (to it)'. Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum mocked Trump's vow, suggesting that North America should be renamed 'América Mexicana' or 'Mexican America'.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 28, 2025 03:27 PM
Source:[Euronews English](https://www.euronews.com/next/2025/01/28/google-maps-will-rename-gulf-of-mexico-as-gulf-of-america-in-the-us-after-trump-order)

**Google says Gulf of Mexico will change to Gulf of America in Maps app: Here's how**
Google Maps will update its name for the 'Gulf of Mexico' to 'Gulf of America' once the change is officially updated in the U.S. Geographic Names System. The decision comes after President Donald Trump signed an executive order requiring the federal government to make the change. Google said it will apply the name change when it is updated in official government sources, and will also start using the name 'Mount McKinley' to refer to the mountain in Alaska currently called Denali. The company stated, 'We have a longstanding practice of applying name changes when they have been updated in official government sources.' The Gulf of Mexico is the ninth largest body of water in the world, covering more than 615,000 square miles and bordering Mexico's coast as well as the U.S. southern coast. Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has already referred to the Gulf as 'Gulf of America' in a state of emergency declaration, saying, 'Whereas an area of low pressure moving across the Gulf of America, interacting with Arctic air, will bring widespread impactful weather to North Florida beginning Tuesday.'
Original language: en
Publish date: January 28, 2025 02:11 PM
Source:[USA Today](https://eu.usatoday.com/story/tech/2025/01/28/gulf-mexico-google-maps-america-mckinley-denali/77990503007/)

**Google Maps Is Renaming the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America**
Google has announced that it will rename the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America, following a request from US President Donald Trump. According to Google, this is standard practice when a name is changed in official government sources. The change will be reflected on Google Maps, with users in the US seeing the body of water named 'Gulf of America' and users in Mexico still seeing it as 'Gulf of Mexico'. Users outside the US and Mexico will see both names next to each other. Google claims that this is a common practice, citing the example of the Sea of Japan, which has been disputed by North and South Korea. Apple has yet to announce its plans for Apple Maps, but it is expected to follow Google's lead.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 28, 2025 01:03 PM
Source:[MakeUseOf](https://www.makeuseof.com/google-maps-gulf-of-mexico-name-change/)

**Google Maps to Change 'Gulf of Mexico' to 'American Gulf'**
According to a post on X, Google Maps will change the name of the 'Gulf of Mexico' to 'American Gulf' once the 'Geographic Information System' database, which contains US geographical names and location information, is officially updated. This change is expected to occur after January 27, 2025, when the database was updated. As of now, there is no statement from Google regarding this change. The Gulf of Mexico is a significant body of water located in the southeastern United States and Mexico, and the name change may have implications for navigation and geographical references.
Original language: ja
Publish date: January 27, 2025 11:54 PM
Source:[ニューズウィーク日本版 オフィシャルサイト](https://www.newsweekjapan.jp/headlines/world/2025/01/534481.php)

**Politics of maps: Cartographers ponder next steps after Trump’s abrupt geographic renaming scheme**
President Donald Trump's executive order to rename the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America and North America's highest mountain peak from Denali to Mt. McKinley has sparked a round of rethinking by mapmakers and teachers, as well as snark on social media. Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum joked that if Trump went ahead with the renaming, her country would rename North America 'Mexican America.' Despite Florida Governor Ron DeSantis putting the 'Gulf of America' on an official document, it is unclear how many others will follow Trump's lead. Map lines are inherently political, and there is no agreed-upon scheme to name boundaries and features across the Earth. Many countries have different names for the same body of water, such as the Persian Gulf, the South China Sea, and the Rio Grande/Rio Bravo. National Geographic, Google, and Apple have not yet changed their maps to reflect Trump's executive order, and it is unclear how many others will follow suit. 'It is, I suppose, an internationally recognized sea, but (to be honest), a situation like this has never come up before so I need to confirm the appropriate convention,' said Peter Bellerby, a cartographer at Bellerby & Co. Globemakers. 'If, for instance, he wanted to change the Atlantic Ocean to the American Ocean, we would probably just ignore it.'
Original language: en
Publish date: January 25, 2025 12:00 AM
Source:[milwaukeeindependent.com](https://www.milwaukeeindependent.com/newswire/politics-maps-cartographers-ponder-next-steps-trumps-abrupt-geographic-renaming-scheme/)

**The Gulf of Whatnow? Mapmakers grapple with Trump's geographic renaming plans. - The Boston Globe**
Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum joked that if Trump's plan to rename the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America were to happen, her country would rename North America 'Mexican America.' However, she later clarified that the Gulf of Mexico will continue to be called by its original name. The renaming plan is part of Trump's executive order 'Restoring Names That Honor American Greatness.' Mapmakers are grappling with the issue, with some questioning the feasibility of changing the name of a widely recognized body of water. Peter Bellerby, a cartographer, said, 'If, for instance, he wanted to change the Atlantic Ocean to the American Ocean, we would probably just ignore it.' National Geographic stated that it does not comment on individual cases, but strives to be apolitical and consult multiple authoritative sources. The company also includes explanatory notes for place names in dispute, such as the Sea of Japan and the East Sea.
